com.rubynaxela.teaeditor.util

Class DataFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rubynaxela.teaeditor.util.DataFormat

  • public final class DataFormat
extends java.lang.Object
    The DataFormat class provides a number of data format related functions that are used for validating input and displaying output data
    Author:
    Jacek Pawelski

      static java.lang.String formatNumber(double number)
      Formats a number returning a String; removes .0 when the value is a whole number
      static java.lang.String formatNumber(double number, java.lang.String suffix)
      Formats a number returning a String: removes .0 when the value is a whole number, can add a suffix at the end of the number
      static java.lang.String formatNumber(double number, java.lang.String suffix, java.lang.String zeroText)
      Formats a number returning a String: removes .0 when the value is a whole number, can add a suffix at the end of the number, can replace the whole string with some text when the value is equal to 0.

      Checks if a given String is valid grams data (compatible with the database format)

      Checks if a given String is a valid ID, that is, whether it only consists of small latin letters and underscores

      Checks if a given String contains a valid parsable integer (and not a floating point number) (where "" is also considered valid as it is parsed to 0)

      static boolean isValidRating(java.lang.String number)
      Checks if a given String contains valid rating (is in range from 1 to 5 with step 0.5) (where "" is also considered valid as it is translated to null)

        Returns:
        true if the String is a valid ID and false otherwise

      • isValidNumber

        public static boolean isValidNumber(@Nonnull
                                    java.lang.String number)
        Checks if a given String contains a valid parsable floating point number (where "" is also considered valid as it is parsed to 0)
        Parameters:
        number - a String value
        Returns:
        true if the String contains a valid number and false otherwise
        See Also:
        parseDouble(java.lang.String)

      • isValidInteger

        public static boolean isValidInteger(@Nonnull
                                     java.lang.String number)
        Checks if a given String contains a valid parsable integer (and not a floating point number) (where "" is also considered valid as it is parsed to 0)
        Parameters:
        number - a String value
        Returns:
        true if the String contains an integer and false otherwise
        See Also:
        parseInt(java.lang.String)

      • isValidRating

        public static boolean isValidRating(@Nonnull
                                    java.lang.String number)
        Checks if a given String contains valid rating (is in range from 1 to 5 with step 0.5) (where "" is also considered valid as it is translated to null)
        Parameters:
        number - a String value
        Returns:
        true if the String contains valid rating and false otherwise

      • roundNumber

        public static double roundNumber(double number,
                                 double unit,
                                 DataFormat.RoundMode mode)
        Rounds a number to a multiple of a given unit
        Parameters:
        number - a numeric value
        unit - a unit to round to
        mode - can be one of: FLOOR - rounds down; CEIL - rounds up; ROUNDS - rounds to the closest multiple of the unit
        Returns:
        a double containing the rounded number

                              DataFormat.RoundMode mode)

        Parameters:

        mode - can be one of: FLOOR - rounds down; CEIL - rounds up; ROUNDS - rounds to the closest integer
        Returns:
        a double containing the rounded number

      • formatNumber

        @Nonnull
public static java.lang.String formatNumber(double number,
                                                     @Nullable
                                                     java.lang.String suffix,
                                                     @Nullable
                                                     java.lang.String zeroText)
        Formats a number returning a String:
        • removes .0 when the value is a whole number,
        • can add a suffix at the end of the number,
        • can replace the whole string with some text when the value is equal to 0.
        Parameters:
        number - a numeric value
        suffix - the suffix, may be null
        zeroText - displayed when the value is equal to 0, displays the number normally when null
        Returns:
        a String containing the formatted number

      • formatNumber

        public static java.lang.String formatNumber(double number,
                                            @Nullable
                                            java.lang.String suffix)
        Formats a number returning a String:
        • removes .0 when the value is a whole number,
        • can add a suffix at the end of the number
        Parameters:
        number - a numeric value
        suffix - the suffix, may be null
        Returns:
        a String containing the formatted number
